style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">39,883</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The effective interest rate on the liability component of the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">0.5%&#160;Notes due 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">4.43%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three and nine months ended</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.  The remaining unamortized bond discount of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$311.6&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;as of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;will be amortized over the remaining life of the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">0.5%&#160;Notes due 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, which is approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">6.1</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;years.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The conversion provision of the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">0.5%&#160;Notes due 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;allows the holders the option to convert their notes during a calendar quarter if the Company&#8217;s stock price exceeds </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">130%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of the conversion price of the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">0.5%&#160;Notes due 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for at least 20 trading days during the last 30 consecutive trading days of the previous calendar quarter.  Based on the last closing price of the quarter ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$99.21</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the Company&#8217;s common stock, if all of the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">0.5%&#160;Notes due 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;were converted, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">1.2&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;shares would be distributed to the holders.  As of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">0.5%&#160;Notes due 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;were not convertible.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Concurrent with the issuance of the </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">0.5%&#160;Notes due 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company entered into a convertible bond hedge transaction in which counterparties agreed to sell to the Company up to approximately </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">16.3 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock, which is the number of shares issuable upon conversion of the </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">0.5%&#160;Notes due 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in full, at a price of </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">$92.19</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;per share.  The convertible bond hedge agreement contains provisions where the number of shares to be sold under the convertible bond hedge transaction and the conversion price will be adjusted if the Company pays a cash dividend greater than a regular </font></div><br><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">23</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><a name="sF3AF15532706DE19F799CC53DED89843"></a><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;"><a style="font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;" href="#s640E6C76214F72FEC5EECC53F7B791DD"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;">Table of Contents</font></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;text-indent:26px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">SANDISK CORPORATION</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;text-indent:26px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;text-indent:26px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">(unaudited)</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;text-indent:26px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><br><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">quarterly cash dividend of $0.225&#160;per share or makes a distribution to all or substantially all holders of its common stock.  After adjusting for dividends in excess of $0.225&#160;per share paid through </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the counterparties may acquire up to approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">16.3&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock, which is the number of shares issuable upon conversion of the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">0.5%&#160;Notes due 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in full, at a price of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$92.12</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;per share.  This convertible bond hedge transaction will be settled in net shares and will terminate upon the earlier of the maturity date of the </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">0.5%&#160;Notes due 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;or the first day that none of the </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">0.5%&#160;Notes due 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;remain outstanding due to conversion or otherwise.  As of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">Company had not purchased any shares</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;under this convertible bond hedge agreement.  Settlement of the convertible bond hedge in net shares, based on the number of shares issuable upon conversion of the </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">0.5%&#160;Notes due 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, on the expiration date would result in the Company receiving net shares equivalent to the number of shares issuable by the Company upon conversion of the </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">0.5%&#160;Notes due 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In addition, concurrent with the issuance of the </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">0.5%&#160;Notes due 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company sold warrants to acquire up to approximately </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">16.3&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;shares of its common stock at an exercise price of </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">$122.9220</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;per share.  The warrant agreement contains provisions whereby the number of shares to be acquired under the warrants and the strike price are adjusted if the Company pays a cash dividend greater than a regular quarterly cash dividend of $0.225&#160;per share or makes a distribution to all or substantially all holders of its common stock.  After adjusting for dividends in excess of $0.225&#160;per share paid through </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, holders of the warrants may acquire up to approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">16.3 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock at a strike price of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$122.8232</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;per share.  The warrants mature on </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">40 different dates from January&#160;13, 2021 through March&#160;11, 2021</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and are exercisable at the maturity date.  At each maturity date, the Company may, at its option, elect to settle the warrants on a net share basis.  As of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the warrants had not been exercised and remain outstanding.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><br><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">24</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><a name="sD7E71B1B0EDD3316EAC0CC53DED8D2F3"></a><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;"><a style="font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;" href="#s640E6C76214F72FEC5EECC53F7B791DD"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;">Table of Contents</font></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;text-indent:26px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">SANDISK CORPORATION</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;text-indent:26px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;text-indent:26px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">(unaudited)</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;text-indent:26px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><br><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Note </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">7</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">.</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Share Repurchases</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In July 2013, the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors authorized a program to repurchase up to </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">$2.5&#160;billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of the Company&#8217;s common stock.  As of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the remaining authorization for share repurchases under the program was </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">$1.13&#160;billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.  The share repurchase program will remain in effect until the available funds have been expended or the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors terminates the program.  The Company&#8217;s prior share repurchase program, which was initially announced in </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">October 2011</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and authorized the repurchase over a five-year period of up to </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">$1.25&#160;billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, as increased by the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors in </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">December 2012</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, was completed in the third quarter of fiscal year 2013. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Under the Company&#8217;s share repurchase program, shares repurchased are recorded as a reduction to Capital in excess of par value and Retained earnings in the Company&#8217;s Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheets.  The repurchases will be made from time to time in privately negotiated or open market transactions, including under plans complying with Rule 10b5-1 of the Securities Exchange Act, or in structured share repurchase programs, and may be made in one or more repurchases, in compliance with Rule 10b-18 of the Securities Exchange Act.  Share repurchases are subject to market conditions, applicable legal requirements and other factors.  The share repurchase program does not obligate the Company to acquire any specific number of common stock, or any shares at all, and may be suspended at any time at the Company&#8217;s discretion.  As part of the share repurchase program, the Company has entered into, and may continue to enter into, structured share repurchase transactions with financial institutions.  These agreements generally require that the Company make an up-front payment in exchange for the right to receive a fixed number of shares of its common stock upon execution of the agreement, with a potential increase or decrease in the number of shares at the end of the term of the agreement.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In the third quarter of fiscal year 2013, under the Company&#8217;s share repurchase program, the Company entered into an accelerated share repurchase (&#8220;ASR&#8221;) agreement with a financial institution to purchase </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;">$1.0&#160;billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of the Company&#8217;s common stock.  In exchange for an up-front payment of </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;">$1.0&#160;billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the financial institution committed to deliver shares during the ASR&#8217;s purchase period, which ended on </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;">April&#160;8, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.  During the third quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2013</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;">14.5&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;shares were initially delivered to the Company under this ASR agreement.  The up-front payment of </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;">$1.0&#160;billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;was accounted for as a reduction to Stockholders&#8217; equity in the Company&#8217;s Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheet.  In April 2014, the ASR was settled and the Company received an additional </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">0.6 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;shares from the financial institution for a total of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">15.1&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;shares, which resulted in a volume-weighted-average price of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$66.07</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;per share.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:justify;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The Company reflected the ASR as a repurchase of common stock for purposes of calculating earnings per share and as a forward contract indexed to its own common stock.  The forward contract met all of the applicable criteria for equity classification, and therefore, was not accounted for as a derivative instrument. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Under the Company&#8217;s share repurchase programs, since the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2011 through </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company spent an aggregate </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;">$2.62&#160;billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to repurchase </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;">39.8&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;shares.  Included in the aggregate repurchase activity are </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">8.7 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;shares that were repurchased for an aggregate amount of </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;">$799.5&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;during the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.  In addition to repurchases under the Company&#8217;s share repurchase program, during the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company spent </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$38.4 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;to settle employee tax withholding obligations due upon the vesting of restricted stock units (&#8220;RSUs&#8221;) and withheld an equivalent value of shares from the shares provided to the employees upon vesting.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><br><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">25</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><a STATEMENTS</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;text-indent:26px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">(unaudited)</font></div><div months ended</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font Amount Declared</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">On </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">October&#160;15, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors declared a dividend of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.30</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;per share for holders of record as of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">November&#160;3, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, which is to be paid on </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">November&#160;24, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.  Future dividends are subject to declaration by the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Share&#8209;based</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">&#32;Benefit Plans</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Share&#8209;based</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;Plans.  </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The Company has a </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">share&#8209;based</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compensation program that provides its Board of Directors with broad discretion in creating equity incentives for employees, officers, non-employee board members and non-employee service providers.  This program includes incentive and non-statutory stock option awards, stock appreciation rights (&#8220;SARs&#8221;), RSUs, performance-based cash bonus awards for Section 16 executive officers and an automatic grant program for non-employee board members pursuant to which such individuals will receive option grants or other stock awards at designated intervals over their period of board service.  These awards are granted under various programs, all of which are stockholder approved.  Stock option awards generally vest as follows: 25% of the shares vest on the first anniversary of the vesting commencement date and the remaining 75% vest proportionately each quarter over the next 12 quarters of continued service.  RSUs generally vest in equal annual installments over a four-year period.  Initial grants to non-employee board members under the automatic grant program vest in equal annual installments over a four-year period and subsequent grants to non-employee board members generally vest over a one-year period in accordance with the specific vesting provisions set forth in that program.  Additionally, the Company has an Employee Stock Purchase Plan (&#8220;ESPP&#8221;) that allows employees to purchase shares of common stock at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">85%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of the fair market value at the subscription date or the date of purchase, whichever is lower.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Valuation Assumptions</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Option Plan Shares</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">.</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;&#32;The fair value of the Company&#8217;s stock options granted, excluding unvested stock options assumed through acquisitions, was estimated using the following weighted-average assumptions:</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><div style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">At </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the total unrecognized compensation cost related to stock options, net of estimated forfeitures, was approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$48.1&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, and this amount is expected to be recognized over a weighted-average period of approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">2.2</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">years</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.  As of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company had fully expensed all of its SARs awards.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Restricted Stock Units.  </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">RSUs are settled in shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock upon vesting on a one-for-one basis.  Typically, vesting of RSUs is subject to the employee&#8217;s continuing service to the Company.  The cost of these awards is determined using the fair value of the Company&#8217;s common stock on the date of grant, and compensation is recognized on a straight-line basis over the requisite vesting period.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><br><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">27</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><a style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">During the three months ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company implemented a restructuring plan which primarily consisted of reductions in workforce in certain functions of the organization worldwide because of redundant activities due to the Fusion-io acquisition, as well as realignment of certain projects.  A restructuring charge of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$10.1&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;was recorded during the three months ended </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, of which </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">$9.5&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;related to severance and benefits for involuntary termination in all functions of approximately </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">134</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;employees, primarily in the U.S.  The remaining </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">$0.6&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;was primarily for asset disposals and an excess lease obligation.  All expenses, including adjustments, associated with the restructuring plan are included in Restructuring and other in the Company&#8217;s Condensed Consolidated Statements of Operations.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:18px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The Company anticipates that the remaining restructuring reserve balance will be paid out in cash through the second quarter of fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;in connection with employee transition programs. </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;text-indent:18px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Other Costs</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">During the three months ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company recognized other costs of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$14.9&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;related to its acquisition of Fusion-io.  Acquisition costs of </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;">$8.9&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;primarily consisted of expenses incurred for legal, banker, accounting and tax fees.  The remaining costs incurred were primarily related to litigation and integration expenses.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><br><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:middle;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">31.4</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:middle;padding-right:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">%</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:middle;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;padding-left:12px;text-indent:-12px;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">32.1</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:middle;padding-right:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;padding-left:12px;text-indent:-12px;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">%</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:middle;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;padding-left:12px;text-indent:-12px;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">31.0</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:middle;padding-right:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;padding-left:12px;text-indent:-12px;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">%</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The provision for income taxes for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">three and nine months ended</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;differs from the U.S. statutory tax rate of 35% primarily due to the tax impact of earnings from foreign operations, state taxes, non-deductibility of certain </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">share&#8209;based</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;compensation, tax audit settlements and tax-exempt interest income.  Earnings and taxes resulting from foreign operations are largely attributable to the Company&#8217;s Chinese, Irish, Israeli and Japanese entities.  Earnings in these countries where tax rates are lower than the U.S. notional rate contributed to the majority of the difference between the rate of the Company&#8217;s tax provision and the U.S. statutory tax rate.  The lower effective tax rate for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three months ended</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, compared to the same period in fiscal year 2013, is primarily attributable to a benefit recorded as a result of tax audit settlements.  The higher effective tax rate for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">nine months ended</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, compared to the same period in fiscal year 2013, is attributable to the federal R&amp;D tax credit not being extended as of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, while the </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">September&#160;29, 2013</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;effective tax rate includes both the 2013 federal R&amp;D credit and retroactive inclusion of the 2012 federal R&amp;D tax credit, and changes in the composition of operating income by tax jurisdiction, partially offset by a benefit recorded as a result of tax audit settlements.  As of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company believes that most of its deferred tax assets are more likely than not to be realized, except for certain loss and credit carry forwards in certain U.S. and foreign tax jurisdictions.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Unrecognized tax benefits were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$117.0 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$185.3 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;as of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">December&#160;29, 2013</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, respectively.  Unrecognized tax benefits that would impact the effective tax rate in the future were approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$92.3&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.  Interest and penalties included in income tax expense in each of the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">three and nine months ended</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">September&#160;29, 2013</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;were immaterial.  It is reasonably possible that within the next 12 months, unrecognized tax benefits could decrease by up to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$4.6&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;as a result of potential settlements of tax authority examinations and could decrease by up to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$9.6&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;as a result of the expiration of statutes of limitation.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The Company is subject to U.S. federal income tax as well as income taxes in multiple state and foreign jurisdictions.  In August 2014, the Company received and signed the closing agreement from the Internal Revenue Service (&#8220;IRS&#8221;) relating to its federal income tax returns for the fiscal years 2005 through 2008.  During the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three months ended</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company recorded a discrete benefit of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$25.2 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;as a result of several audit settlements.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The IRS recently initiated an examination of the Company&#8217;s federal income tax returns for fiscal years 2009 through 2011.  The Company does not expect a resolution of this audit to be reached during the next twelve months.  In addition, the Company is currently under audit by various state and international tax authorities.  The Company cannot reasonably estimate the outcome of these examinations, or provide assurance that the outcome of these examinations will not materially harm the Company&#8217;s financial position, results of operations or liquidity.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><br><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">31</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><a name="sF616F7CA3DC74736C5C4CC53DCA3FE9D"></a><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;"><a style="font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;" href="#s640E6C76214F72FEC5EECC53F7B791DD"><font #000000;background-color:#cceeff;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#cceeff;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;background-color:#cceeff;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">33,581</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;background-color:#cceeff;"><div style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;background-color:#cceeff;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">22,831</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;background-color:#cceeff;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Basic earnings per share exclude any dilutive effects of stock options, SARs, RSUs, warrants and convertible debt.  Diluted earnings per share include the dilutive effects of stock options, SARs, RSUs, ESPP, the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">1.5%&#160;Notes due 2017</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">0.5%&#160;Notes due 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, and warrants issued in conjunction with the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">1.5%&#160;Notes due 2017</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.  Certain common stock issuable under stock options, SARs, RSUs, and warrants issued in conjunction with the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">0.5%&#160;Notes due 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, has been omitted from the current year diluted net income per share calculation because the inclusion is considered anti-dilutive.  Certain common stock issuable under stock options, SARs, RSUs, the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">1%&#160;Notes due 2013</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">1.5%&#160;Notes due 2017</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, and warrants issued in conjunction with the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">1%&#160;Notes due 2013</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">1.5%&#160;Notes due 2017</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, has been omitted from the prior year diluted net income per share calculation because the inclusion is considered anti-dilutive.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:26px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><br><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">32</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><a name="s3A9B37F7AEA3603D0807CC53DCDF17DB"></a><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;"><a style="font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;" href="#s640E6C76214F72FEC5EECC53F7B791DD"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;">Table of Contents</font></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;text-indent:26px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">SANDISK CORPORATION</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;text-indent:26px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;text-indent:26px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">(unaudited)</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;text-indent:26px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><br><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:60px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Note </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">12</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">.</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Commitments, Contingencies and Guarantees</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Flash Ventures</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Flash Ventures, the Company&#8217;s business ventures with Toshiba, consists of three separate legal entities: Flash Partners Ltd., Flash Alliance Ltd. and Flash Forward Ltd.  The Company has a </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">49.9%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;ownership interest in each of these entities and Toshiba owns </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">50.1%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of each of these entities.  Through these ventures, the Company and Toshiba have collaborated in the development and manufacture of NAND flash memory products, which are manufactured by Toshiba at its wafer fabrication facility located in Yokkaichi, Japan, using semiconductor manufacturing equipment owned or leased by Flash Ventures.  The entities within Flash Ventures purchase wafers from Toshiba at cost and then resell those wafers to the Company and Toshiba at cost plus a markup.  The Company accounts for its ownership position in each Flash Ventures entity under the equity method of accounting.  The Company is committed to purchase its provided three-month forecast of Flash Ventures&#8217; NAND wafer supply, which generally equals </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">50%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of Flash Ventures&#8217; output.  The Company is not able to estimate its total wafer purchase commitment obligation beyond its rolling three-month purchase commitment because the price is determined by reference to the future cost of producing the semiconductor wafers.  In addition, the Company is committed to fund </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">49.9%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;of Flash Ventures&#8217; costs to the extent that Flash Ventures&#8217; revenue from wafer sales to the Company and Toshiba are insufficient to cover these costs.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Flash Partners. </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;Flash Partners Ltd. (&#8220;Flash Partners&#8221;) was formed in fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2004</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.  NAND flash memory products provided to the Company by this venture are manufactured by Toshiba at its 300-millimeter wafer fabrication facility (&#8220;Fab 3&#8221;) located in Yokkaichi, Japan.  As of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company had notes receivable from Flash Partners of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$13.7&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, denominated in Japanese yen.  These notes are secured by the equipment purchased by Flash Partners with the note proceeds.  The Company also has guarantee obligations to Flash Partners; see &#8220;Off-Balance Sheet Liabilities.&#8221;  At </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;29, 2013</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company had an equity investment in Flash Partners of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$183.6&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$190.7&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, respectively, denominated in Japanese yen, adjusted by </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$9.8&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$17.3&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, respectively, of cumulative translation adjustments recorded in AOCI.  The Company records basis adjustments to its equity in earnings from Flash Partners that relate to the difference between the basis in the Company&#8217;s equity investment compared to the historical basis of the assets recorded by Flash Partners.  In the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three and nine months ended</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company recorded no basis adjustments to its equity in earnings from Flash Partners.  In the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three and nine months ended</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;29, 2013</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company recorded a basis adjustment of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.1&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$0.7&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, respectively, to its equity earnings from Flash Partners.  Flash Partners&#8217; share of the Fab 3 fabrication facility is fully equipped.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Flash Alliance.  </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Flash Alliance Ltd. (&#8220;Flash Alliance&#8221;) was formed in fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2006</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.  NAND flash memory products provided to the Company by this venture are manufactured by Toshiba at its 300-millimeter wafer fabrication facility (&#8220;Fab 4&#8221;) located in Yokkaichi, Japan.  As of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company had notes receivable from Flash Alliance of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$338.7&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, denominated in Japanese yen.  These notes are secured by the equipment purchased by Flash Alliance with the note proceeds.  The Company also has guarantee obligations to Flash Alliance; see &#8220;Off-Balance Sheet Liabilities.&#8221;  At </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;29, 2013</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company had an equity investment in Flash Alliance of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$274.3&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$284.0&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, respectively, denominated in Japanese yen, adjusted by </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">($20.0)&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">($8.7)&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, respectively, of cumulative translation adjustments recorded in AOCI.  The Company records basis adjustments to its equity in earnings from Flash Alliance that relate to the difference between the basis in the Company&#8217;s equity investment compared to the historical basis of the assets recorded by Flash Alliance.  In the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three and nine months ended</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company recorded no basis adjustments to its equity in earnings from Flash Alliance.  In the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three and nine months ended</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;29, 2013</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company recorded a basis adjustment of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$1.2&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$6.2&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, respectively, to its equity earnings from Flash Alliance.  Flash Alliance&#8217;s share of the Fab 4 fabrication facility is fully equipped.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Flash Forward. </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;Flash Forward Ltd. (&#8220;Flash Forward&#8221;) was formed in fiscal year </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2010</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.  NAND flash memory products provided to the Company by this venture are manufactured by Toshiba at its 300-millimeter wafer fabrication facility (&#8220;Fab 5&#8221;) located in Yokkaichi, Japan.  Fab 5 was built in two phases.  Phase 1 of the building is fully equipped.  The Company and Toshiba each retain some flexibility as to the extent and timing of each party&#8217;s respective fab capacity ramps.  The Phase 2 shell of Fab 5 is complete and equipment installation has begun.  The Phase 2 shell is currently intended to be used primarily for technology transition of the existing Flash Ventures wafer capacity to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">1Y&#8209;nanometer</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">1Z&#8209;nanometer</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;technology nodes, the addition of a </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">3&#8209;dimensional</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;NAND (&#8220;3D&#160;NAND&#8221;) pilot line, and for the tools required for a planned increase in Flash Ventures wafer capacity of approximately 5%, with such wafer capacity increase planned for 2015.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><br><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">33</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><a name="s3A9B37F7AEA3603D0807CC53DCDF17DB"></a><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;"><a style="font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;" href="#s640E6C76214F72FEC5EECC53F7B791DD"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;">Table of Contents</font></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;text-indent:26px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">SANDISK CORPORATION</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;text-indent:26px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;text-indent:26px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">(unaudited)</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;text-indent:26px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><br><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">As of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company had notes receivable from Flash Forward of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$222.0&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, denominated in Japanese yen.  These notes are secured by the equipment purchased by Flash Forward with the note proceeds.  The Company also has guarantee obligations to Flash Forward; see &#8220;Off-Balance Sheet Liabilities.&#8221;  At </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;29, 2013</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the Company had an equity investment in Flash Forward of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$87.2&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$66.7&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, respectively, denominated in Japanese yen, adjusted by </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">($20.3)&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">($16.2)&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, respectively, of cumulative translation adjustments recorded in AOCI.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Inventory Purchase Commitments with Flash Ventures. </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;Purchase orders placed under Flash Ventures for up to three months are binding and cannot be canceled.  These outstanding purchase commitments are included as part of the total &#8220;Noncancelable production purchase commitments&#8221; in the &#8220;Contractual Obligations&#8221; table.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:18px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Off-Balance Sheet Liabilities</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Flash Ventures.  </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Flash Ventures sells and leases back from a consortium of financial institutions (&#8220;lessors&#8221;) a portion of its tools and has entered into equipment master lease agreements totaling </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">192.4&#160;billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;Japanese yen, or approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$1.76&#160;billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;based upon the exchange rate at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.  As of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the total amount outstanding from these master leases was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">120.8&#160;billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;Japanese yen, or approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$1.11&#160;billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;based upon the exchange rate at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, of which the amount of the Company&#8217;s guarantee obligation of Flash Ventures&#8217; master lease agreements, which reflects future payments and any lease adjustments, was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">60.4&#160;billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;Japanese yen, or approximately </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$553&#160;million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;based upon the exchange rate at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The master lease agreements contain customary covenants for Japanese lease facilities.  In addition to containing customary events of default related to Flash Ventures that could result in an acceleration of Flash Ventures&#8217; obligations, the master lease agreements contain an acceleration clause for certain events of default related to the Company as guarantor, including, among other things, the Company&#8217;s failure to maintain a minimum stockholders&#8217; equity of at least </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$1.51&#160;billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.  As of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, Flash Ventures was in compliance with all of its master lease covenants, including the shareholders&#8217; equity covenant with the Company&#8217;s stockholders&#8217; equity at </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">$6.92&#160;billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;as of </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">.  If the Company&#8217;s stockholders&#8217; equity falls below </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">$1.51&#160;billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, or other events of default occur, Flash Ventures would become non-compliant under its master equipment lease agreements and would be required to negotiate a resolution to the non-compliance to avoid acceleration of the obligations under such agreements.  Such resolution could include, among other things, supplementary security to be supplied by the Company, as guarantor, or increased interest rates or waiver fees, should the lessors decide they need additional collateral or financial consideration under the circumstances.  If a non-compliance event were to occur and if the Company failed to reach a resolution, the Company could be required to pay a portion or the entire outstanding lease obligations covered by its guarantees under such Flash Ventures master lease agreements.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;text-indent:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><br><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">34</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><a name="s3A9B37F7AEA3603D0807CC53DCDF17DB"></a><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;"><a style="font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;" href="#s640E6C76214F72FEC5EECC53F7B791DD"><font based upon the exchange rate at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;">September&#160;28, 2014</font><font
